title: Show maintainer on build failure
body:
Show the maintainer information of a package when its build fails (if the maintainer information is present).

### Rationale

About half of the open issues on the first few "Issue" pages on GitHub relate to build problems instead of problems with Spack itself and some user dump build problems like yesterday with the expectation that
> my understanding is that I report here build errors that I find, which are fixed by the Spack team. Am I correct?

As far as I know, the Spack developers do not maintain the build instructions for the software packages that can be built with Spack but this fact is not obvious at all if a user downloaded Spack and ran `. spack/share/spack/setup-env.sh && spack install something`. The only reason I know about this is because I read the packaging tutorials and saw the "maintainer" entries.

### Description

My suggestion to print the maintainer information when a build fails. Example:
```
$ fgrep maintainers spack/var/spack/repo/builtin/packages/something/package.py
    maintainers = [ "joesixpack1337", "janedoe1337" ]
$ spack install something
./configure
...
Error

The build of package "something" failed. Please contact the GitHub users
  joesixpack1337
  janedoe1337
for assistance.

The Spack developers do *not* maintain this build.
```

### Additional information

Spack v0.16.0, Spack commit 428f8318998f0979918f28ffbb02055895064b74 does not show this information.


### General information

- [x] I have run `spack --version` and reported the version of Spack
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
